intro: Vacoparis, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Vacoparis is native to regions in South America and is often found in wetland or marshy habitats. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and floral display.
